thread.title: Bookmaker blames Trump and Zlatan for profits dip
thread.title_full: Bookmaker blames Trump and Zlatan for profits dip

author: Rob Davies
title: Bookmaker blames Trump and Zlatan for profits dip
text:
Paddy Power Betfair Bookmaker blames Trump and Zlatan for profits dip 
Paddy Power Betfair lost £5m on Donald Trump’s win and £35m on ‘customer friendly results’ such as Manchester United striker Ibrahimovic’s goal streak Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic celebrates scoring the equaliser against Liverpool. Photograph: Tom Jenkins for the Guardian Paddy Power Betfair Bookmaker blames Trump and Zlatan for profits dip 
Paddy Power Betfair lost £5m on Donald Trump’s win and £35m on ‘customer friendly results’ such as Manchester United striker Ibrahimovic’s goal streak Monday 23 January 2017 11.39 GMT Last modified on Monday 23 January 2017 11.53 GMT View more sharing options Share on Messenger Close 
Paddy Power Betfair blamed the unlikely pairing of Donald Trump and the Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic as it cut its full-year profit forecast. 
The “unexpected US election outcome” , in which Trump triumphed over Hillary Clinton in November, cost the bookmaker £5m as it paid out to punters who backed him for the White House. Leicester won the league but the bookies were far from beaten Read more 
The impact was exacerbated by the group’s decision to pay out £800,000 to gamblers who backed Hillary Clinton even before the polls closed, on the assumption that the Democrats’ candidate would win. 
Created last year by the merger of Paddy Power and Betfair, the group also suffered a £35m hit from “customer friendly” sports results towards the end of 2016. 
These included 12 goals in 12 games for Ibrahimovic , who the bookmaker said typically attracts the biggest stakes from gamblers betting on a goalscorer. 
Revenues were up 11% but the group cut its forecast for full-year underlying profits, which it had previously said could reach £405m, to about the “mid-point” between £390m and £405m.
